TI_TEXT.P: Услуги на здравеопазването и социалните дейности

SHORT_DESCR.P: Staffordshire County Council (SCC) wishes to commission a Refugee Integration and Independence Framework to ensure eligible refugees living in Staffordshire are supported to connect with their local communities and have the skills to live independently.

TITLE.P: Targeted Support Service Support for Syrian Refugees

SHORT_DESCR.P: Staffordshire County Council (SCC) wishes to commission a Refugee Integration and Independence Framework to ensure eligible refugees living in Staffordshire are supported to connect with their local communities and have the skills to live independently.
The Framework will consist of three service elements:
1) Targeted Support Service Support for Syrian Refugees during the second and third year of the Syrian resettlement programme this will include:
— Targeted Practical support to the whole family in order to promote and enable sustainable independent living and integration within the local community,

— Targeted Emotional and Behavioural support through the use of mentoring and advocacy for those refugee families with psychological/emotional issues thus impacting on their health, wellbeing and development.

2) Unaccompanied Asylum Seeker Children (UASC) Community Integration Support. The service will support community cohesion between eligible UASC and local community assets (guaranteed for 18 months only).
3) Resettlement support.

The service will meet and greet new arrival refugees and provide practical support to settle and integrate the refugees in the local communities. This element will only be required if a further tranche of refugees are allocated to Staffordshire.
It is anticipated that tender documentation will be available early 3.2018.
Interested bidders are asked to register on the E-tendering Proactis system (below) and express an interest in the opportunity.
To participate in this process we would like to invite organisations interested in this opportunity to:
— Register an expression of interest, using the contract reference number SCHG00170 for this procurement process on our E-tendering Proactis system https://supplierlive.proactisp2p.com/Account/Login
